result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerard J. Garland

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $50 by next court date. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:46 PM Defendant Gerard J. Garland appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Brad Jansen appears for SPD; Atty. Jansen heard; State requests $500 Cash bond; Atty. Jansen response; Court orders: $500 CASH Bond: same prior conditions; Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $50 by next court date.The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Atty. Jansen waives time limits on Def.'s behalf; PH 12/8/22 at 8:30am in Br. 1
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:58 AM Defendant Gerard J. Garland not in court.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Gerard J. Garland.  Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court issues WA; forfeits bond.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:15 AM Defendant Gerard J. Garland in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard; notes Atty withdrew, SPD in process of reappointing; explains time limits. Defendant heard; waives time limits and wants to wait for SPD appointment. Court sets RH & PH.
Review hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on October 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:32 AM Defendant Gerard J. Garland in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $5,000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
